history.text: Hi! So, what's this movie that you've recently seen?
Hello. Have you seen the movie Iron Man?
Yes I have. I really enjoy the Marvel Universe.
Do you think of Iron Man as a super hero? After all, he doesn't have any super powers.
He is definitely a hero, and his intelligence and ability to create technology could be construed as "super", so yes, I do consider hi a super hero.
Do you consider Obidiah Stane to be a super villain?
Yes, again, technologically advanced and all.
So would anyone in a suit be a "super"?
To a degree. Willingness and ability to use the suit matter. Falcon and War Machine are both "super" because of the suits they wear, but it is the people that they are that make them heroes.
Would you watch this film if it focussed on the character of Yinsen, who created the suit with Stark, rather than the man who wore it?
Maybe, but it probably wouldn't be as exciting.
Why do you think they made the suit for Stark, who was injured and unfamiliar with the area, instead of Yinsen?
Stark had the power cell in his chest to power it, right?
Yes, but Yinsen built it.
Why do you think Pepper Potts doesn't have a suit?

Yinsen probably didn't consider himself physically able to control the suit. Pepper spends too much time on Goop looking up alternative medicines and such. Just kidding. I could fully see Pepper Potts donning a suit and being a hero.
Heheh.
It seems that only powerful men get suits, including Obidiah Stain, who doesn't seem to have much physical prowess.
I think that has been the norm, but it is changing. Jessica Jones and Trish Walker (soon to be Hellcat) have started to change the narrative.
I think we'll be seeing a few more Wakandan women on our screens very soon.
What's the difference between Tony Stark and Batman?

There are a lot of differences and similarities between the two. Tony is a show off, Batman is very secretive. They both are wealthy and glean their abilities from intelligence and technology. They are both considered to be leaders by their peers. Tony can fly, Batman can not. Batman has a cave, Tony has a tower.
If you took away their money, would they still be superheroes?
Depends on what kind of situation they were put in, but yes.
The movie got a 79/100 from Metacritic and a 94% of Rotten Tomatoes. Do you think these are fair scores?
Sure. Scores are just a conglomeration of opinions so they are generally not unfair. I would probably put it somewhere between those two.
Unlike Batman, and against the advice of SHIELD, Tony Stark comes out as Iron Man at the end of the film. Do you think this was a wise decision?
Probably not wise, however, Stark doesn't do well with secrecy, so it was inevitable, and probably easier to deal with in the long run.
It does seem to fit his character.
Do you remember how Stark defeated Stain at the end of the film?
Not off hand. It's been a while since I saw it.
It was actually Pepper Potts who saved him by overloading a reactor, causing Stain to fall. I didn't remember that either.
Ah, well, I guess she is the hero afterall.
If only the actress would follow suit, but I digress...
Is it fair to considered Iron Man to be a disabled superhero? Is his suit a fancy wheelchair?
I think that is a bit of a reach.
Would you watch a film where the here is disabled in some way?
here=hero
Sure. I like to see people overcome disadvantages, especially in a heroic way.
And we're done. Thanks for the conversation, and have a great day. :)
u2

uid1response.feedback: A bit tricky, since we were both very familiar with the film.

uid2response.feedback: It had been a while since I saw the movie, and the other user intrigued me to watch it again.
